page.title: 03Ancient Monuments Page 1
page.content: Witchampton spelt originally Wichentune derived from the Saxon denoting the winding river in the original Domesday Book. ANCIENT MONUMENTS- Bridge- built 1795 by Samuel Kent of Witchampton spans the River Allen on the southern approach to the village and has a transportation plaque dating back to George IV. Manor House-1274 remains to be found south east of Abbey House.Originally had solar above and guard rooms below. Roman Buildings- site of, north east of Abbey House.Excavations in 1920's uncovered part of a Roman Villa.Items found and sent to Poole Museum include; mosaic pavement, pottery, roofing tiles, glass fragments ,coin of Constantine I, painted wall plaster and skeletons of men wearing golden ornaments.
